website_summaries.verdict: This rake is a worthy contender that would suit the needs of most consumers. Its quality craftsmanship is backed by a superior warranty.
pros: Its rugged fiberglass handle and cushioned tip are built to withstand serious tasks
The limited lifetime warranty has you covered if issues arise during normal usage
cons: The solid build comes with a downside – it's heavy, which makes it awkward for some consumers to use
Tines have been reported to bend or break

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and very quick
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that during this uncertain time, I have STRUGGLED with getting order through Amazon. This rake arrived much quicker than estimated and is a very good quality and durable rake. My only negative comment is that it is a bit heavier (not a lot) than most of the rakes I have. However, it is of great quality so I would definitely recommend this rake.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Millwood

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME RAKE
customer_reviews.text: ALL I CAN SAY IS THAT I REALLY LIKE THIS RAKE, IT SEEMS LIKE IT IS VERY WELL MADE.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Gatteny

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy.
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed opinions on this rake. Although it is very effective for it's purpose, I find it extremely heavy. I'm a young (mentally) 69 yr old woman but I am not very strong. I purchased this rake to replace a lighter bamboo leaf rake whose tines were pulled out by viney ground cover. With the new rake I am only able to cover 1/4 of the area I used to in a single taking session.
customer_reviews.author: Joanie Pelzer

customer_reviews.title: Serious design flaw: tines bend and snap off.
customer_reviews.text: This rake has serious design flaws. The tines get bent underneath the other ones and snap off. The tines are far too brittle and inflexible (even for thatching). This rake sees little use because I am worried about more tines snapping off. I've had this rake about 2.5 years and used it only about 20 times. I own two Bully Tools shovels and have only good experiences with those. I try and support USA-made products, but this rake is a waste of money and needs to be redesigned.
customer_reviews.author: StraightShooter

customer_reviews.title: I like it so far..
customer_reviews.text: I have 23 acres and rake a lot of debris. This is not a leaf rake but you can use it for that. It is a heavy duty rake. It is heavier than a regular rake and will work you out. I am 64 and in good shape so I don't mind it. I rake a lot of fallen limb debris and the tines are rigid and make it easier to rake the small stuff. Great rake. I just took it for a test run today. Let's see how it holds up after a few months of hard work.
customer_reviews.author: GWP

customer_reviews.title: Extreme duty.
customer_reviews.text: 100% Made in USA. Heavy duty & extreme durability. Heavy. Tines do not bend when raking out hedge rows and shrub lines. You get what you pay for; buy 1 of these or buy 2 from big box stores. You will never replace it! Great product; recommended. The design of this rake is not intended to rake up acorns and small debris; just look at the tines and the spacing of the heavy gauge metal. As the product description states, it is for thatching and pulling larger leaves. Each tool has a specific purpose! Bully makes a poly rake if you need one for such tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great rake love this rake
customer_reviews.text: Strong tough made to last. I bought for my yard and garden. Great quality stand up to abuse of every day use. Thick handle. I'm buying another one just to have two
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Best rake I have owned in my 60+ years
customer_reviews.text: The beefiest, most well-built and sturdiest rake I have ever owned. My last leaf rake lasted me 23 years, and was not built anywhere near as well as the Bully Tools Leaf & Thatching rake, so I expect this rake to outlast me. It is a heavy, and thick-handled rake, so not for small hands or arms that aren't used to working, but for able-bodied individuals, this is one heck of a good rake. I raked the thatch from my lawns over a two-day period just after receiving the rake, and it did an excellent job, including making easy work of the edged along concrete curbing, where the old spring-tooth rake wasn't as good.
customer_reviews.author: Steve W. in Idaho

customer_reviews.title: For the Particular Gardner!
customer_reviews.text: This is a workman’s rake! Strong steel tynes, well made all around!
customer_reviews.author: R. Drake

customer_reviews.title: So far.... Great !
customer_reviews.text: Not an inexpensive rake, but then, it's not a cheap import from a big box store either. Wish I had one starting 25 years ago ago when I began the annual ritual of de-thatching my 6000 sq.ft. of fescue lawn. I had always performed this back-wrenching chore with a hard rake. This rake was far more effective, raster and easier to use! It looks and feels very well built, and it backed by a lifetime warranty. I cannot yet attest to it's durability, as that part of the review would come years later.
customer_reviews.author: Cindyc

customer_reviews.title: Awful everyday rake
customer_reviews.text: This rake was very disappointing. You want a rake to be easy to use, flexible enough to go over rocks & roots and lightweight, so you don't get tired – this rake fails horribly. Very heavy, very stiff. Who cares if it last forever, if it's miserable to use. Bully needs to scrap this thing.... the tines are very thick and brittle, they catch leaves too and require manual clearing. You can use this beast as a de-thatching rake... but there are better tools designed just for that purpose. Awful, awful rake.
customer_reviews.author: James D Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This is not your ordinary rake. It is designed to break up thatch and that it does very well. Its very sturdy. The tines are rods and not very flexible; they are not the flat flexible metal of typical rakes. Once I break up thatch spots with this rake its faster and easier to use my regular rake (with it's flat tines) to move the dead grass over surrounding live grass. If there is a con it would be its weight. Some cushy foam on the handle would be a nice touch. Its a wide handle...much wider than a standard rake. Workable but not ideal for a female's hands.
customer_reviews.author: CGM

customer_reviews.title: I like that aspect of it
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a well-built rake that will last forever, this is the rake for you. I like that aspect of it, but if you use it for any length of time, you will find that it will wear you out. Way too heavy and the metal tines make considerable noise while raking.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis L. Habeck

customer_reviews.title: Great for heavy duty raking.
customer_reviews.text: I'd say it's between a leaf and thatch rake. I use it for removing debris out of vine patch or any area that requires a greater degree of debris removal than a leaf rake. Bully tools stands behind their products. A few tines snapped off. Called the company, and they shipped a new on for free. Believe they have re-designed this rake so the tines or more flexible, but it has substantial weight behind it. A useful tool in your garden arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: SonnyK

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. The bully tools brand really has high ...
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty. Good quality. The bully tools brand really has high quality durable products.
customer_reviews.author: Isa Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: USA
customer_reviews.text: I will always pay more money for USA products!!! the quality shows! Much stronger and durable than the cheap China or Mexico made crap you get a big box stores.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Built like a tank
customer_reviews.text: You should have seen my face when I picked this rake up. The weight alone told me that this rake is built like a tank. This is one of the best-built rakes I have ever owned while running my landscaping company. Will be purchasing again worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Icardi

customer_reviews.title: Better be a bully to use this rake
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, too sturdy which makes it unusually heavy. Too many leaves get stuck in the tines way too fast because they are so thin. Wider tines and a lighter handle would improve this rake a lot. Haven't used as a thatching rake because it didn't do a sufficient job on the leaves. Seems too springy to be a very good thatcher though. It'll last forever and that is why I gave it a generous 2 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Al Watson

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but good....
customer_reviews.text: Keeping in mind these reviews... I bot it.. used it for the first time, It's on the heavy side, but strong and you can leave it to your kids... I have no clue how that 1 guy broke the tines, but I dont plan to move rocks with it...
customer_reviews.author: Scott Riesner

customer_reviews.title: Best Rake ever made!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best Rake ever made!!! Cant say enough about this great quality American made tool! I tell everyone; "you want a tool you only have to buy once... ever. Buy a Bully" #NEVERANOTHERBRAND
customer_reviews.author: BAA

customer_reviews.title: Now THAT'S a rake!!
customer_reviews.text: Of course it's heavier than a cheap rake...you could fight a bear with this thing. Please be nice to bears though, it rakes leaves very well too.
customer_reviews.author: Ric Wasden

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy rake!
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of replacing rakes every year - sometimes twice in a year. This rake is meant to last! The tines are welded and the handle is very sturdy - maybe fiberglass? Not sure. What I do know is this is a beast! Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: debg

customer_reviews.title: You pass on to next generation!
customer_reviews.text: I love this very strong and America made rake! I have a dirt backyard and this is my favorite tool to rake, mostly foxtails and weeds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Co, Good rake, Bad shipping
customer_reviews.text: Good rake but was mailed in a plastic bag and the STEEL tines were bent 90 deg... Company refunded with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great rake. Built in USA. Awesome quality the last rake you will ever buy
customer_reviews.author: Poe and pie

customer_reviews.title: Nice rake
customer_reviews.text: Did the job. Tines never bent without going back into position, and I gave it a workout
customer_reviews.author: focuspest

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT HIGH QUALITY TOOL. SHOULD LAST MANY YEARS. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT.
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT HIGH QUALITY TOOL. SHOULD LAST MANY YEARS. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT. CAME ALL FULLY ASSEMBLED AND WRAPPED WELL FOR SHIPPING. NOTHING TO PUT TOGETHER, AS I HAD EXPECTED.
customer_reviews.author: John Morley

customer_reviews.title: Just wish the handle was a little longer
customer_reviews.text: Built like a tank, and the stiff tines are great for thatching and yard clean. (Probably too stiff for routine leaf raking, but I live in a new development that used to be a sod farm. Do the math.) Biggest gripe: the handle is too short for my 6'4" frame. Wish it was 6-12" longer. If you're of average height, this won't be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: KingQuadder

customer_reviews.title: Way to heavy
customer_reviews.text: The product is sturdy but way to heavy to use. It was impossible to take my lawn for more than three minutes. If I was a 6’5” 230 pound male maybe this rake could be good. The rake did not come in a box and it’s an awkward item to return so I’m stuck with a useless rake. Need to buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany G.

customer_reviews.title: The real deal.
customer_reviews.text: They weren't kidding when they said it was heavy. The Sherman tank of rakes.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Koules

customer_reviews.title: Strong and heavy
customer_reviews.text: Great but be prepared to manhandle it. Not for the fragile wife to clean a few leaven from the yard. However strong guys can seriously move material with it.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and is a heavy duty rake, just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.author: Batman12

customer_reviews.title: Very Durable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rake. Much beefier than any other I have ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: CoMet

customer_reviews.title: Only two minor flaws in this rake, but would ...
customer_reviews.text: Only two minor flaws in this rake, but would not have changed my purchase decision. 1.) is that its a little to round and you will tend to rake with the top 6 to 8 prongs unless you lower your angle and 2. I wish it was 3 inches longer I stand at 5' 10" and could definitely use a few more inches to this.
customer_reviews.author: Kayakfisher

customer_reviews.title: Meet your next rake
customer_reviews.text: This rake is great! The tines don't bend. It isn't too heavy and the handle is a good length. It would be handy if the handle was a few inches longer but yard tools aren't typically made for tall people.

customer_reviews.title: The rake you always new could be made,
customer_reviews.text: This is the rake you always needed!. Watch the company video...it is everything they say it is. It is a bit heavy because it is built to last. It rakes, it thatches, and it picks up the raked material. you will put your name on it to be sure it never leaves your home!
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Lozano

customer_reviews.title: HEAVY RAKE
customer_reviews.text: excellent rake. A little heavy but it will outlast the walmart specials. I went through three rakes before purchasing this one. The wood handles would crack in half. I raked (thatched) my entire yard (1/2 acre) and it stood up great. Are you going to pay a little more,yes,but the quality is there. This rake will be in my shed for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: 2LEGIT

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty wonder
customer_reviews.text: Great rake for heavy duty work and thatching. A bit heavy for common leaf raking....it will wear you out for that purpose. Solid USA construction that has a place in your multiple rake collection. If you only need one, pick a lighter one but trust me, a heavy duty one has its place to clear around shrubs, raking heavy thatched grass, and standing up to years and years of use!
customer_reviews.author: Chez

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Very solid rake....... My yard man thinks it is too heavy. I am a woman and do not feel the same. I appreciate th a t a little hard work gets the job done faster. The tines are very thick. Wish the handle was longer.
customer_reviews.author: Magie

customer_reviews.title: Rugged for heavy use.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, well constructed and durable. It is heavy, for a rake. I use this rake when burning brush and the all-metal construction makes this a good choice. If you just intend to rake leaves, this might be too heavy for some users.
customer_reviews.author: Senior64

customer_reviews.title: Works very well when trying to eliminate moss
customer_reviews.text: Rake is a little heavier than a leaf rake. Able to remove moss easily.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela K. Scott

customer_reviews.title: This tool is very sturdy and performs well
customer_reviews.text: This tool is very sturdy and performs well. I would like it if the handle was just a little longer but it works well as is. It is hard to find a rake that has a sturdily attached handle. This one does.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wide. Good rake
customer_reviews.text: Very durable. Will buy this brand again. Worth the extra few dollars it costs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Built to last
customer_reviews.text: The rake is well built and is expected to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: rick

customer_reviews.title: because the tines are round they don't seem to pick ...
customer_reviews.text: because the tines are round they don't seem to pick up as much as if they had a bit more flex and flat
customer_reviews.author: Dan Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: With Bully Tools you cannot go wrong. The rake is made of high quality materials and craftsmanship. The price is fair and you get a outstanding tool. The best thing of all it is Made in the U.S.A. which means american jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Not a good tool for leaves
customer_reviews.text: Not what I was expecting. They seem to be using the same handle stock material they use for everything else. In this case it is not a wise choice. I will use the rake for a different application then what I wanted it for. I belief a leaf rake should be strong, but light weight. It should have a firm but flexible and springy action that is suitable for leaves and thatch. This rake is too heavy and has little or no spring. The handle is to big around to be comfortable. For heavy duty use it will have some function. But definitely not what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh B. MacLeod

customer_reviews.title: This rake is too heavy for easy raking but works great at picking up debris such ...
customer_reviews.text: This rake is too heavy for easy raking but works great at picking up debris such as pine straw and large leaves after raking them into a pile.
customer_reviews.author: Swamp Rat

customer_reviews.title: Bully Tools
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough good things about Bully Tools! I love their rake and their pitchfork! Both are constructed with superior material and craftsmanship!
customer_reviews.author: Richard W. Wisenor

customer_reviews.title: love tools like these
customer_reviews.text: heavy duty, tough rake. love tools like these. built like a tank
customer_reviews.author: James Rizer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: You probably will never need to purchase another rake like this again . Extremely well made and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Donald S.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but that's becuase it is high quality.
customer_reviews.text: As stated by others, this is heavy. Get ready for a workout. Overall very sturdy and I can see that it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith

customer_reviews.title: A little heavy. There is fiberglass that is lighter
customer_reviews.text: These rakes last a long time. Best built. Not like plastic garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic rake for what it is, which is mainly a de-thatcher, and for any other application where a heavy duty stiffer rake would outperform something more flexible.
customer_reviews.author: Magnum4zz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great lawn rake, enjoy the weight of this one and seems like its going to last a good while.
customer_reviews.author: T. C.

customer_reviews.title: Bully Tools must think the consumer will equate stupid heavy with quality
customer_reviews.text: I try to always buy US products but this was a mistake. Bully Tools must think the consumer will equate stupid heavy with quality. In addition to the " pry bar" weight of the handle it is too short to get any mechanical advantage. And the tines rusted within the first week at the natural friction point. Whoever designed this clunker never did a days work.
customer_reviews.author: e. norton

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for de-thatching
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty for de thatching your lawn. way better than a thatching rake
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great rake.
customer_reviews.text: This is a real leaf/twig rake...my cheap rakes were toys.
customer_reviews.author: dconjr50

customer_reviews.title: very poor packaging
customer_reviews.text: It was sent in a flat box and arrived with two broken tines. This is not a flat item. I do like the rake and will continue to purchase these American made Bully Tools.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Strong and heavy.
customer_reviews.text: It's heavy and it's more than a rake--it's also a plow. This rake is built like an armored rhinoceros. Plus, if you want to build up your arms a bit, this is rake that will do it. It's most definitely not for the weak or indolent. It's brute force entirely...there's no finesse about it. It does what it's designed to do--rake and plow.
customer_reviews.author: Rock Hard

customer_reviews.title: Great heavier duty rake
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rake, does the job it was intended to do that a light duty rake couldn't do. I wouldn't use it for casual raking though. Still 5 stars in my mind.
customer_reviews.author: Jim K

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Tough. High quality rake that will last a lifetime if used properly
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Could Be More Durable...
customer_reviews.text: The tines can break off easily when raking landscaping rocks and the wider spacing of the round tines means that smaller debris will slip through. The company has an excellent warranty and sent me another rake after I sent them pictures of the missing tines on the first rake they sent. It's made in America too and that always makes me feel a little better about my purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with this purchase, and would not recommend the product to anyone. The tines are very thin, and do not work well when raking. There are several better choices, for less money.
customer_reviews.author: Robert P

customer_reviews.title: it works OK
customer_reviews.text: It works OK and seems to be made well, the tines will bend easy so I have to be careful about that. It is a little heavy compared to a plastic one i had used but it does work well and is made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Diancatzdogz

customer_reviews.title: Clunky, difficult to hold (very wide), too heavy, rigid tines don't bend easily, too narrow width.
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased that the rakes arrived early, delivered to my door early one morning before anyone was awake. They were packed very well, lots of extra padding and protection. Upon opening them, I noticed how heavy and over-large the handles were. When I finally got them out of the packaging, I tried a bit of raking. The tines don't bend! Sure they bend slightly at the tips, but not in the way a leaf rake is supposed to bend so that you can pick up leaves in a big clump. I'm not sure what the maker intended with this rake. It's too heavy, inefficient and clunky. I plan on returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Sweet

customer_reviews.title: Not for removing thatch
customer_reviews.text: Was looking forward to getting this rake to dethatch my lawn. Didn't work. My regular steel tine rake did a much better job at removing thatch. Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: Corvette Guy

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: broke while I was dethatching lawn. Very Sorry piece of equipment!
customer_reviews.author: Herman Yarborough

customer_reviews.title: Bully Lawn and Leaf Rake
customer_reviews.text: A rake made in the USA is what I wanted. I have been a landscaper for 30 years and have used many rakes. When I received the Bully Lawn and Leaf rake it was not what I was hoping for. The tines were not flexible, but stiff, and the handle too wide and cumbursome; the whole tool was heavy and I felt fatigued after one use. After one month, some tines broke off. I want to return it now.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Babes

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE. have not use this rake much at all ...
customer_reviews.text: TERRIBLE. have not use this rake much at all and three tines broke off. China makes a better rake than this.
customer_reviews.author: tammy cedus

product_meta.title: Bully Tools 92312 Leaf and Thatching Rake with Fiberglass Handle and 24 Spring Steel Tines
product_meta.description:
The Bully Tools Steel Thatching Rake is one of the toughest rakes avaliable. The spring steel tines are able to pick up river rocks and other heavy duty debris. The triple wall fiberglass resists breakage while still being lightweight and easy to handle.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Tools made to last a lifetime, and be passed on from generation to generation. 100% Made in the USA Bully Tools is bringing back that tradition with tools built to endure years of hard labor. We have re-engineered the classic designs of shovels, rakes and other popular tools to create more efficient, durable products. Special features on specific products include true 14 gauge steel, triple wall reinforced fiberglass handles, extended length ferrules, and welded I-beam supports. We stand behind our products and offer a limited lifetime warranty. If one of our tools fails during normal use, we will replace or refund it! In a time when cheap foreign products are the norm, Bully Tools offers affordable, high quality Made in the USA goods.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars161 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
